intro: Casearia novoguineensis, commonly known as the New Guinea casearia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of New Guinea. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its opposite, simple leaves. The plant produces small, white or yellowish flowers that are clustered in cymes, followed by small, berry-like fruits. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats within lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
